events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred on highway 98 involving a collision with another vehicle. Immediate claim initiation was requested.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial accident report and involved vehicles.
An agent was assigned to handle the claim and coordinate communication between the insured party and the insurance company.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the insured customer, ensuring them that the investigation will proceed promptly.
The insured was requested to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and a copy of their driver’s license for verification.
All requested documents including the police report and photos of the accident site were submitted by the insured as per requirements.
The investigation team began assessing the details of the collision and reviewing submitted documents and witness statements.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured vehicle was hit from the rear, and fault was determined to be with the other driver.
A settlement amount covering all repair costs and rental car expenses was proposed to the insured for approval.
The insured expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and fair settlement offer, appreciating the clear communication.
The claim was officially approved following the insured's acceptance of the proposed settlement and terms.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued to the insured's bank account to cover all repair and related costs.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that all payments had been processed and the insured was fully compensated.
All claim documentation and records were archived in the company’s system for future reference and regulatory compliance.
